result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany L Kapitanski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
*Sentence to commence after the restitution hearing which is scheduled for 2/03/2016.
31 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid during Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Attend a Cognitive Behavioral Course.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim or her family or residence.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
BAIL WILL BE HELD IN TRUST UNTIL RESTITUTION HEARING.
It is further ordered that the Defendant is not to remove or harm the value of the home she resides in and she is to cooperate with the realtor on 1/28/2016.

AMENDED ON 5/26/2017:  "Pursuant to the Victim's Accounting of Liquidated Restitution dated September 28, 2016, the defendants have paid $153,946.63 towards the restitution owed."

CORRECTED ON 2/08/16: $629.11 to be added to make the new total $397,958.49 (this is paid to J. Gunderson) jointly and severally w/co-defendants

AS OF 2/03/2016: RESTITUTION WAS ADDED IN THE AMOUNT OF $397,329.38 (jointly and severally w/co-defendants) As follows: $388,000.00 - to Ms. A. Gunderson, $47.68 for doctor visits, $4,901.75 for lost wages, $679.47 for the Safe, $150.00 for a sweater and 2 blankets, $435.14 for Gun fees and permit, and $3,115.34 for Alarm system. $2,500.00 BAIL WAS APPLIED. $2,500.00 was refunded back to the poster.
25% to come out of prison wages to be applied to Restitution,  not any monies deposited from the outside of the prison. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. Civil judgment to be entered if not paid.

Defendant Tiffany L Kapitanski in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Biskupic on behalf of the victim.  Parties stipulate to the restitution amount of $629.11 owed to Mr. Gunderson jointly and severally. Court grants and orders that amount jointly and severally. Antoinette Gunderson was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense. Jeffrey Gunderson was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense. Detective Stephen Westphal was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense. Court orders restitution jointly and severally regarding Ms. Gunderson in the amount of $388,000.00 plus
$47.68 doctor visits
$4901.75 lost wages
$679.47 for the safe
$150.00 for a sweater and 2 blankets
$435.14 gun fees and permit
$3115.34 Alarm System
TOTAL $397,329.38
FRUTHER ORDERED court does sign the orders regarding the Quick Claim Deed regarding the homes and order regarding the vehicle and copies of said orders provided to Attorney Biskupic. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that any restitution paid, only 25% be taken out of their prison pay, not any monies deposited from the outside of prison. 

Court further orders the $2500.00 from the bail be applied to the restitution and the balance be refunded back to poster.

Memorandum in Support of Motion for Restitution Judgment and Necessary Orders/Writs Securing Return of Property filed by Attorney Biskupic

Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 1/21/16

Motion for Restitution Judgment and Necessary Orders/Writs Securing Return of Property filed by Attorney Biskupic

for Restitution Hearing filed by Attorney Biskupic

Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 1/21/16

Defendant Tiffany L Kapitanski in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State presents statements. Victim makes statements.  Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

 4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 31 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 1/2  YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
 *Attend a Cognitive Behavioral Course
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  the victim or her family or residence
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  To be determined

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. 
BAIL TO REMAIN IN TRUST UNTIL THE NEXT HEARING.

IT IS FURTHER ordered that the defendant is not to remove or harm the value of the home that she resides in  
and she is to cooperate the realtor on 01/28/2016. 

Sentence to commence after the restitution hearing scheduled for 02/03/2016 @ 1:30 pm.

Four character letters filed by Attorney Hartley.
